titleStmt.title: A curious collection of paintings, or the most famous, ancient and modern masters viz. Vandyke. ... Van Zoon. With many other great masters. Will be expos'd to sale Fryday December 11th. and continue till all are sold, beginning at two a clock, and hold till nine. at the Vendu next Bedford Gate in Charles-street Covent-Garden. Catalougs [sic] may be had at the place of sale. The conditions are, he that bids most is the buyer, and none to bid less then sixpence. If a difference ariseth, the picture must be put up again. And the buyers to fetch away their lots within three days after they are bought.

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 20 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 5 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: To the extent possible under law, the Text Creation Partnership has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above, according to the terms of the CC0 1.0 Public Domain Dedication (http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). This waiver does not extend to any page images or other supplementary files associated with this work, which may be protected by copyright or other license restrictions. Please go to https://www.textcreationpartnership.org/ for more information about the project.

titleStmt.title: A curious collection of paintings, or the most famous, ancient and modern masters viz. Vandyke. ... Van Zoon. With many other great masters. Will be expos'd to sale Fryday December 11th. and continue till all are sold, beginning at two a clock, and hold till nine. at the Vendu next Bedford Gate in Charles-street Covent-Garden. Catalougs [sic] may be had at the place of sale. The conditions are, he that bids most is the buyer, and none to bid less then sixpence. If a difference ariseth, the picture must be put up again. And the buyers to fetch away their lots within three days after they are bought.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p:
A Curious Collection OF PAINTINGS, OF THE Moſt Famous, Ancient and Modern Maſters, viz.
Vandyke.
P P Rubens.
Snyder.
Paul Veroneſe.
Rembrant.
Lucas van Leyden.
Andrew del Certa.
Jordans.
Frances Floras.
Percellus.
Vinkebone.
Meerens.
De Vos.
Melvius.
Teneers.
Flink.
Levens.
Van Begas.
Goltius.
Bonaventure Peters.
Fronciſco.
Moor.
Van Hook.
Brugel.
Mompert.
Bryenberg.
Muliner.
Willebeck.
Young Frank.
Soft Laven.
Bodway.
Old Wyck.
Hondius.
Signior Babtiſt.
Polinbergh.
Van Zoon.

Will be expos'd to Sale Fryday December 11th. and continue till all are ſold, beginning at two a Clock, and hold till nine at the VENDU next Bedford Gate in Charles-ſtreet Covent-Garden. Catalougs may be had at the place of Sale.

The Conditions are,
He that bids moſt is the buyer, and none to bid leſs then Sixpence.
If a difference ariſeth, the Picture muſt be put up again.
And the buyers to fetch away their lots within three days after they are bought.

list.item: 4 K. James the Firſt, after Van Somer.
8 K. Charles the Second, a half length.
9 Venus and Cupid on Copper, by Van Heyden.
13 A peice of Dogs, by Jonk Heer.
14 A Had well done in ſmall.
17 A Dog and Hare by Hondius.
18 A Beautifull Parrot and ſtone-work, by Stanly.
19 Our Saviour ſinking under the Croſs, by Van Houke.
20 A ſpaniſh Family of Cor. Johnſon.
22 A Two Ladys and a Lamb by Mrs. Carlile.
23 A Head well painted, of Honyman.
25 A view of Amſterdam by an Ancient Maſter.
31 A Fruit peice finely painted, by Gaſper Verbrugen.
32 Our Saviour betrayd, painted by P P. Rubens.
33 Herodias with St. John's Head by Stretten.
35 A pheſant painted on cloath in imitation of board, by Walden.
36 Europa on a Bull, a sketch.
42 A very fine peice of ſtill life, by Deheems Maſter.
43 Lucas Van Leydens head don by himſelf.
45 A Pilgrim, by a great Italian Maſter.
47 The diſputation in the Temple on Copper, by Young Frank.
48 A Spark & his miſtreſs by Leroon.
49 A Magdelen in ſmall, an Original.
50 A Flower-peice of Signior Baptiſt, in a Gold Frame.
52 Joſeph and Potaphers wife, by Caſtro.
53 A fruit-peice, and Original wonderfully painted.
54 A peice of Fruit, Plate &c. extream finely finiſht by Willebeck.
57 A very fine Original, by an Italian.
58 A muſical oonverſation of Boores, by Soft Laven.
63 A Muſick-peice ſinely finiſht by Muliner.
64 A Man holding a Horſe, by Old Wyck.
65 A Society, a curious Original of a great Maſter.
66 Youth and Age, a night-peice, a curious Original.
70 A Head, of An hony Moor.
75 Alexander and Diogenes, very Maſterly and Correct.
77 The Sacrifice of Ephigenia, by Lemence.
78 The Duke of Venice by Rembrant
80 An old mans Hend of Antony Moor.
82 Lot and his two daughters, by an ancient hand.
83 Elias in the wilderneſs, by Franciſco Saruge.
86 Ruben's Head very fine in ſmall.
88 A peice of Fowl, an Original, well painted.
90 Venus and Cupid, very fine by Verelſt.
92 A large branch of Fruit admirable painted, by Van Zoon.
99 Caſmus firſt grand Duke of Florence.
103 A Parrot and Stonework well painted in ſmall.
104 Judith with Holefernes's head, by Hudfon.
106 King Charles the Second in ſmall.
107 A Calves-pluc, &c. well painted by Luctine.
108 A Dary-maids head by the life.
109 A Blackamoors head, in ſmall, an Originall.
110 Pan an Cyrinx, by Cor, Schutt.
111 A Head by the life in ſmall.
124 Cleopatria on Copper, by Van Heyden.
131 King David with Goliahs head, by Hierogouſt.
132 Ovids head, in Imitation of Stone.
133 Our Saviour on the Croſs, Curiouſly painted.
134 The Counteſs of Bedford, very finely painted.
135 The Lady Rich, Daughter to the Counteſs of Devonſhier, ditto.
136 A Cock Hens, and Guinnypigs, very Curiouſly painted, an Originall.
138 A Rabbit and Guinypigs, a Curious Originall.
140 Fruit and Birds, very fine by Michael Angelo.
143 A piece of Italian Fowl, by Fraciſco.
145 A Hand and Partridge Curiouſly painted, an Originall.
149 Lazarus by a great Italian Maſter.
150 A piece of Birds of Badway.
151 A Sea Storme by Vande Velde.
152 A Quince &c. by the famous Nelvius.
153 A curious Landskip of Mompert, the Figures Brugel.
154 Herodias dancing a very fine Original of Paul Veronees.
155 A Turbant with a Paradice Bird finely painted.
156 Suſanna with the Elders after Rubens.
157 A ſmall Landskip very fine of Henne.
158 A Landskip delicately painted with figures by Guilewogar.
160 A Faulconer and his Dogs by Van Begas.
161 A very fine peice of Griffeir.
162 A Dutch Woman in her Element by Meerens.
167 A Landskip by a great Maſter.
169 A very fine ſmall Landskip Original of Henne.
170 Dogs courſing Swans by a Dutch Maſter.
172 Fowl with a dead Partridge by an Italian.
173 A Landskip and figures extream fine by Guilewogar.
174 A Carpet &c. an extraordinary fine Original.
177 A Duck and Mallard well painted.
179 A Sea peice of Vande Velde of Anthwerp.
180 Mars and Venus by a diſciple of Lereſs.
181 A Landskip and Figures of Holbein.
182 Tents and horſes by Vande Veld.
183 A very fine Winter peice by Deſtomna.
185 Oliver Lord St Johns Ambaſſador to Sweedland finely painted.
187 A Landskip with Shepherds and Shepherdeſſes.
189 Dead Fowl and a Hare finely painted an Original.
190 A man and woman making Love.
191 A Fire piece by a Dutch Maſter.
193 A piece of Harveſt by Winſelboven.
197 A very fine piece of Figures by Brugel.
198 A fine horſe by Van Baken.
203 A ſmall Landskip of Van Joaſt.
205 A Rummer and Olives by Verelſt.
207 A fine Sea piece by Percellus.
210 Figures after the manner of Brugel.
216 A piece of Autum by Winſelhoven.
227 A Three quarter Fruit-piece by young Hondius.
218 A Winter an Summer well painted.
219 A very fine original Landskip of Loten.
221 Venus and Cupid on board ditto.
225 A Madona very Curious in ſmall.
227 A Child half Serpent by Derike.
228 A Dog and Oxes head a very fine Original.
230 An Oyſter piece. by Van Hatten
231 A Plate and Lemmon very fine.
232 King James the firſt of Vanſomer.
233 Venus and Pallas by a great Italian Maſter in a very rich Frame.
235 A Duck piece curiouſly done in ſmall by Van Hatten.
236 Our Saviour in the Temple finely painted.
237 A Buck-hunting by a great Maſter.
238 A Head thought to be of Vandike.
241 A wonderfull fine original Buck hunting.
242 A Venus and Cupid Original of Jordans.
243 A fine Original Curiouſly preſerv'd of Frunces Flora.
244 Daniel in the Lions Den by a Diſciple of Rubens.
245 A merry company chooſing King and Queen.
246 A Drunken frolick by Van Cleve.
247 A naked Woman very finely painted by Mr. Cook.
248 A very fine Madona of Voit.
250 A Curious Landskip and Figures by De Vas.
251 A very fine Conſort of Birds by Brugel.
252 A Landskip of Wouters the Figures of Brienbergh.
255 A woman ſealing a letter very fine by Meers.
256 A peice of Ducks &c. by Fyt.
257 A large Original perſpective by Peter de Neefe.
259 A Bear-baiting by a Dutch Maſter.
262 A Cupid repreſenting Vanity by Flink.
264 A Bare and Dogs by Scoof.
267 The flight into Aegypt curiouſly painted.
268 A piece of Fruit with a glaſs of Wine curiouſly done.
269 Armidas a ſleep Original of Vandike.
271 An Old Mans head finely done by Levens.
273 A Large Flower peice very fine by W. Verelſt.
274 The Duke of Munmouth a whole length.
275 A Battle between Turks and Germains by Cliberg.
276 A large peice of Geeſe & well painted.
277 Catts in a Buttery, a fine Original of Snyder.
278 The three Kings worrſhipping, by Van Hook Diſciple of Rubens.
279 Sampſon threatning his Father in law, by Rembrant.
280 A Battle between the Turks and Germains.
283 A Proſpect of Dover well painted.
288 A Battle by a Dutch Maſter.
290 Horſemen in a grotto by young Frank.
292 Froſt on the Thames by Wagoner.
294 Signior Loorand the Famous Italian, by an Italian Maſter.
307 A Flora on Copper by Van Heyden.
